com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.drm

Class VirtuosoDrmSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.drm.VirtuosoDrmSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.media.MediaDrm.OnEventListener, IVirtuosoDrmSession<android.media.MediaCrypto>
    public class VirtuosoDrmSession extends java.lang.Object implements IVirtuosoDrmSession<android.media.MediaCrypto>, android.media.MediaDrm.OnEventListener
    An implementation of the IVirtuosoDrmSession interface for the default MediaCrypto class which is used by the DRM framework. This is used by the VirtuosoDrmSessionManager. If you are managing DRM sessions with a custom manager then it is unlikely that this will be of benefit to the implementation.

      Constructor and Description
      VirtuosoDrmSession 
      VirtuosoDrmSession(java.lang.String id, SessionId sessionId, android.media.MediaDrm mediaDrm, android.media.MediaCrypto mediaCrypto, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager manager)
      Construct a session.
      public VirtuosoDrmSession(java.lang.String id, SessionId sessionId, android.media.MediaDrm mediaDrm, android.media.MediaCrypto mediaCrypto, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager manager)
      Construct a session.
      Parameters:
      id - The id used to track the session in the session manager.
      sessionId - The DRM Session ID
      mediaDrm - The MediaDrm object belonging to the player.
      mediaCrypto - The MediaCrypto object used to process the keys.
      manager - The manager to be called from the internal handler for processing events.

      requiresSecureDecoderComponent 
      boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
      public boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Description copied from interface: IVirtuosoDrmSession
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.

      Normally this method should return MediaCrypto.requiresSecureDecoderComponent(String), however in some cases implementations may wish to modify the return value (i.e. to force a secure decoder even when one is not required).

      This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: IVirtuosoDrmSession.STATE_OPENED, IVirtuosoDrmSession.STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

      Specified by:
      requiresSecureDecoderComponent in interface IVirtuosoDrmSession<android.media.MediaCrypto>
      Returns:
      Whether the open session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
